item.title: Dattatreya
item.description:
Dattatreya: The Unified Divine Principle in Hinduism

Introduction

Dattatreya is a prominent Hindu deity, widely revered as an incarnation (avatar) of the divine trinity â€“ Brahma (the creator), Vishnu (the preserver), and Shiva (the destroyer). This unique amalgamation represents the unified principle of the universe, embodying creation, maintenance, and transformation. Dattatreya is often depicted as a serene yogi, representing renunciation and wisdom, yet he also embodies the powers of all three major deities. His worship is prevalent across various Hindu traditions, and he is regarded as a guru, a yogi, and a compassionate benefactor of humanity.
